law.catch_line: Legislative electronic information system to be established and maintained.

text.section: The Legislative Research Commission shall establish and maintain a legislative electronic information system that includes the status of bills and resolutions publicly active within the legislative process and related information, including sponsors, summaries, and committee referrals. Electronic access to this information shall be made available to all agencies of the Commonwealth, its political subdivisions, and to the public. The Legislative Research Commission shall impose such conditions and restrictions upon nonlegislative access as it determines necessary.

Interim committee information, including membership, meeting times, locales, agendas, and related information shall be a part of the legislative electronic information system. Electronic access to this information shall be as provided in subsection (1) above.

law.history: Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 46, sec. 9, effective September 1, 1996. -- Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 66, sec. 1, effective July 13, 1990.
